column2: ENGLISH
Host a Wedding feast
Host a Wedding at court, inviting all of your vassals and courtiers to the event.
column3: Organiser un banquet de mariage en invitant tous vos vassaux et courtisans.
column6: Organizar una boda en la corte, invitando a todos tus vasallos y cortesanos al evento.

column2: Married Life
A wedding ceremony and feast shall be held for [This.GetTitledFirstName] [This.GetOnlyDynastyName] and [This.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] [This.Spouse.GetOnlyDynastyName]\n
column3: Une cÈrÈmonie de mariage et un banquet seront organisÈs pour [This.GetTitledFirstNameWithDynasty] et [This.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] [This.Spouse.GetOnlyDynastyName]\n
column6: [This.GetTitledFirstNameWithDynasty] y [This.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] [This.Spouse.GetOnlyDynastyName] organizar·n la boda y el banquete\n

column2: This character is to be wed.
Holding a wedding
§Y[This.Holder.GetTitledFirstName]§! §Gis pleased§! with the wedding\n
§Y[This.Holder.GetTitledFirstName]§! §Ris not pleased§! with the wedding\n
Wedding of [Root.GetTitledFirstName] [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]
Being officially wed according to the customs of your faith will legitimize your rule among your subjects, and also offers a chance to impress your allies.
Send word that you accept the invitation\n
Attending Wedding
Away From Court
When someone is away from their home court leading armies, it is much more difficult for them to discover plots...and all but impossible to have more children.
Scandalized by Duel at Wedding
Got Along At Wedding
Rejected Wedding
Argued At Wedding
Imperial Intrigue
The constant intrigue swirling about the imperial court is currently working against this character.
Send word that you refuse the invitation\n
Refused to Attend Wedding
§Y[This.Holder.GetTitledFirstName]§! is §Gattending§! the wedding\n
§Y[This.Holder.GetTitledFirstName]§! has §Rrefused§! to attend the wedding\n
Attended Wedding
Outraged
Performed Wedding
Refused Bribe
Refused Favor
Ask the host's permission to duel
Has become your good friend\n
Is furious at you for your behavior\n
Your Favor will be called in to reverse [This.GetHerHis] decision
[From.GetFirstName] of House [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] was formally coronated as [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] on [GetDateText].
[Root.GetDynName] was formally coronated as [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] by [Root.RelHead.GetBestName] on [GetDateText].
[From.GetDynName] was formally coronated as [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] by [From.RelHead.GetBestName] on [GetDateText].
Your poetry goes over well
Your poetry goes over poorly
Quietly inform [This.GetHerHim] of the danger [This.GetSheHe] is in...
Is informed of your decision
Allow them to duel before the court!\n
Berate [This.GetHerHim] for embarrassing you like this
Is §YMaimed§! and has a chance of being captured\n
No vassal of Duke tier or higher has an opinion of less than 0 towards you\n
Is offered a bribe in exchange for reversing [This.GetHerHis] decision
Is offered a Favor in exchange for reversing [This.GetHerHis] decision
Begin plans for wedding...
§Y[From.GetBestName]§! does not learn what you've done\n
§Y[From.GetBestName]§! discovers your treachery\n
The pope would agree to hear your request\n
Reacts to potential loss of the title
Is angry that their duel has been refused
Send a request to perform the wedding\n
The invitations are sent!\n
Agrees to not have their duel, for now
Tell your conspirators to prepare themselves...\n
Will consider the request
Is §YWounded§! and has a chance of being captured\n
Imperial Wedding
Being officially coronated by a priest of your faith will legitimize your rule among your subjects, and also offers a chance to impress your allies.
Request a Wedding by the High Septon

Enacting this decision will result in a request to the High Septon for a wedding ceremony to be held at [RelHead.Capital.GetName] in honour of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]. This will allow [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] to become crowned and blessed by the High Septon and legitimize your position as the ruler of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].
Royal Wedding
Being officially coronated by a priest of your faith will legitimize your rule among your subjects, and also offers a chance to impress your allies.
Excellent, send out a message to invite all my lords
I will attend the ceremony
I refuse to set foot in that pompous windbag's castle

Preparations for your wedding are officially underway, your septon assures you he will begin selecting the hymns to be sung during your ceremony and that the sept will be in its full splendor during it, now, to the guest list!

Preparations for your wedding are officially underway, your castellan reports that your godswood needs some urgent tending if it's to host your bannermen. With your approval for some renovations, he leaves, now, to the guest list!

Preparations for your wedding are officially underway, a priest will be needed. It's not an easy task dragging those men away from the sea, which gives you an idea-maybe you could host the affair by the shore!

Preparations for your wedding are officially underway. You can always find a willing priest to preside over the wedding of a distinguished Valyrian noble. Now, to what's really important, the guest list!

Preparations for your wedding are officially underway. All of the city's nobles are speculating exactly what your plans are for such an occasion, as politics here in the Free Cities are closely related to married life!

Preparations for your wedding are officially underway. Your attention completely dedicated to matters of household staff, stocking food and beverage, accommodations-surely a marriage event should be easier to arrange!

Preparations for your heir's wedding are officially underway. Your septon assures you he will begin selecting the hymns to be sung during the ceremony and that the sept will be in its full splendor for the occasion. Now, to the guest list!

Preparations for your heir's wedding are officially underway. Your castellan reports that the castle godswood needs some urgent tending if it's to host your bannermen. With your approval for some renovations, he leaves, now, to the guest list!

Preparations for your heir's wedding are officially underway, a priest will be needed. It's not an easy task dragging those men away from the sea, which gives you an idea-maybe you could host the affair by the shore!

Preparations for your heir's wedding are officially underway. You can always find a willing priest to preside over the wedding of the successor to a prominent Valyrian family. Now, to what's really important, the guest list!

Preparations for your heir's wedding are officially underway. All of the city's nobles are speculating exactly what your plans are for such an occasion, as politics here in the Free Cities are closely related to married life!

Preparations for your heir's wedding are officially underway. Your attention completely dedicated to matters of household staff, stocking food and beverage, accommodations-surely a marriage event should be easier to arrange!
This looks alright to me!

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA],
I am pleased to invite you to my forthcoming wedding at [From.Capital.GetName]. There, I will be officially wed to [From.Spouse.GetTitledFirstName] [From.Spouse.GetOnlyDynastyName] in the sight of [From.Religion.GetRandomGodNameCap], and your presence would be most welcome.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledName]
I will gladly attend
I have other things to do
Send an envoy in my stead
Alas, the war detains me
Alas, I am far too busy at present
Sadly, the outbreak of war in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] means that the wedding festivities will have to be cut short.

My [Root.GetLordLady],
Sadly, the outbreak of war in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] means that the wedding festivities will have to be canceled. My apologies for the inconvenience.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
That's too bad
With your untimely death, the wedding festivities will clearly need to be canceled.
And I was SO close!
And I was JUST wed!

My [Root.GetLordLady],
Sadly, the untimely death of [From.GetTitledName] obviously means that [From.GetHerHis] wedding must hereby be canceled. We regret the inconvenience.

Signed,
The Chancellor of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]
The Wedding at [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]

The rainbow crystals are dazzling, the sept bursting with light, then, as the doors swing open the attention of the guests all rests upon [From.Spouse.GetLordLady] [From.Spouse.GetFirstName] as she enters the room guided by [From.Spouse.GetHerHis] family, once all is ready [From.job_spiritual.GetJobTitle] [From.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] then begins reciting passages from the Seven-Pointed Star, while guiding the faithful in prayer, reciting vows and singing hymns.

With the ceremony nearing the trade of solemn vows, the soon-to-be in-laws remove the bride's maiden cloak with [From.Spouse.GetHerHis] House colours, and, a new one is placed on [From.Spouse.GetHerHis] shoulder with the colours of House [From.GetOnlyDynastyName], [From.GetHusbandWife] and [From.Spouse.GetHusbandWife], then, repeat the words "With this kiss I pledge my love and take you for my lady and wife" and "take you for my lord and husband", respectively, and with the blessing of the Gods, the septon states that they are ìone flesh, one heart, one soul, now and foreverî.

The streets of [From.Capital.GetName] are lined with [From.Capital.Culture.GetName] crowds cheering, with everyone straining to get a look at the important personages that pass by on their way to the forthcoming feast.

The rainbow crystals are dazzling, the sept bursting with light, then, as the doors swing open the attention of the guests all rests upon [From.Heir.Spouse.GetLordLady] [From.Heir.Spouse.GetFirstName] as she enters the room guided by [From.Heir.Spouse.GetHerHis] family, once all is ready [From.job_spiritual.GetJobTitle] [From.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] then begins reciting passages from the Seven-Pointed Star, while guiding the faithful in prayer, reciting vows and singing hymms.

With the ceremony nearing the trade of solemn vows, the soon-to-be in-laws remove the bride's maiden cloak with [From.Heir.Spouse.GetHerHis] House colours, and, a new one is placed on [From.Heir.Spouse.GetHerHis] shoulders with the colours of House [From.Heir.GetOnlyDynastyName], husband and wife, then, repeat the words "With this kiss I pledge my love and take you for my lady and wife" and "take you for my lord and husband", respectively, and with the blessing of the Gods, the septon states that they are ìone flesh, one heart, one soul, now and foreverî.

The streets of [From.Capital.GetName] are lined with [From.Capital.Culture.GetName] crowds cheering its future ruler's wedding, with everyone straining to get a look at the important personages that pass by on their way to the forthcoming feast.

The godswood is surprisingly quiet, considering it is packed with guests from all over the Kingdom. Breaking the silence, some important bannermen, [From.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] and [From.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName] are urging the guests to make way. With everyone gathered now under the sight of the weirwood, the soon-to-be [From.Spouse.GetHusbandWife] is guided by [From.Spouse.GetHerHis] family and delivered into the hands of [From.GetTitledFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName].

Then, as custom [From.job_chancellor.GetTitledFirstName] asks the groom's name, "[From.GetFirstName] of House [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]", turning to the bride [From.job_chancellor.GetSheHe] asks the same, "[From.Spouse.GetFirstName] of House [From.Spouse.GetOnlyDynastyName]", [From.Spouse.GetSheHe] responds. After trading matrimonial vows, both kneel before the weirwood in submission. Then, as both get up, a silent prayer is offered to the Gods, followed by the groom removing the maiden's cloak and placing his own around her shoulders, closing the ceremony.

One by one, the guests start leaving the sacred godswood, making their way inside the warm castle walls. Now, to the feast!

The godswood is surprisingly quiet, considering it is packed with guests from all over the Kingdom. Breaking the silence, some important bannermen, [From.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] and [From.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName] are urging the guests to make way. With everyone gathered now under the sight of the weirwood, the soon-to-be [From.Heir.Spouse.GetHusbandWife] is guided by [From.Heir.Spouse.GetHerHis] family and delivered into the hands of [From.Heir.GetFirstName] [From.Heir.GetOnlyDynastyName].

Then, as custom [From.job_chancellor.GetTitledFirstName] asks the groom's name, "[From.Heir.GetFirstName] of House [From.Heir.GetOnlyDynastyName]", turning to the bride [From.job_chancellor.GetSheHe] asks the same, "[From.Heir.Spouse.GetFirstName] of House [From.Heir.Spouse.GetOnlyDynastyName]", [From.Heir.Spouse.GetSheHe] responds. They then trade matrimonial vows, kneeling before the weirwood in submission. After that, as both get up, a silent prayer is offered to the Gods, followed by the groom removing the maiden's cloak and placing his own around her shoulders, closing the ceremony.

One by one, the guests start leaving the sacred godswood, making their way inside the warm castle walls. Now, to the feast!

Marriage between dragonlords is truly a family affair. It's hard not to find shared ancestry amongst the freeholders as close as a generation or two, so it's no surprise when the ceremony is packed with so many dear cousins, uncles and half-sisters.\n\nAs the more prominent families gather around [From.GetTitledName], dragons soaring above, the Valyrian priest starts reciting chants in High Valyrian, as me and my [From.Spouse.GetHusbandWife] start cutting each other's hands, then, we clasp hands, our blood spilling down a cup, the priest intones a final prayer. First, I take a sip, then [From.Spouse.GetFirstName] takes another. As we turn to our guests, now properly wed before fire and blood, all the present freeholders, dragonlords, and esteemed guests from the dominions, we are rushed down by a procession heading towards the palace halls where the festivities are to be held!

Marriage between dragonlords is truly a family affair, its hard not to find shared ancestry amongst the freeholders as close as a generation or two, so its no surprise when the ceremony is packed with so many dear cousins, uncles and half-sisters.\n\nAs the more prominent families gather around [From.Heir.GetFirstName] [From.Heir.GetOnlyDynastyName], dragons soaring above, the Valyrian priest starts reciting chants in High Valyrian, as the betrothed start cutting each other hands, then, they clasp, their blood spilling down a cup, the priest intones a final prayer, first he takes a sip, followed by the bride, as they turn to the guests, now properly wed before fire and blood, all the present freeholders, dragonlords and esteemed guests from the dominions, they are rushed down by a procession heading towards the palace halls where the festivities are to be held!

The temple is alight, [From.job_spiritual.GetJobTitle] [From.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] recites ceremonial prayers, while the guests respond to each phrase in unison, reciting vows and praising the Lord of Light.

As the priest draws the ceremony to its climax, the bride's family escorts her to the holy [From.job_spiritual.GetManWoman], who asks her to identify herself, "[From.Spouse.GetFirstName] [From.Spouse.GetOnlyDynastyName]" [From.Spouse.GetSheHe] responds, turning to the groom, [From.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] asks, "And who claims [From.Spouse.GetHerHim]?", "Me, [From.GetFirstName] [From.GetOnlyDynastyName]."

Both bride and groom are then asked whether they will share their fire with their spouse-to-be, "to warm each other when the night is dark and full of terrors". After these solemn vows are swapped, the newlyweds then jump over a ditchfire, signaling the end of the ceremony. Now, to the feast!.

The temple is alight, [From.job_spiritual.GetJobTitle] [From.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] recites ceremonial prayers, while the guests respond to each phrase in unison, reciting vows and praising the Lord of Light.

As the priest draws the ceremony to its climax, the bride's family escorts her to the holy [From.job_spiritual.GetManWoman], who asks her to identify herself, "[From.Heir.Spouse.GetFirstName] [From.Heir.Spouse.GetOnlyDynastyName]" [From.Heir.Spouse.GetSheHe] responds, turning to the groom, [From.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] asks, "And who claims [From.Heir.Spouse.GetHerHim]?", "Me, [From.Heir.GetFirstName] [From.Heir.GetOnlyDynastyName]."

Both bride and groom are then asked whether they will share their fire with their spouse-to-be, "to warm each other when the night is dark and full of terrors". After these solemn vows are swapped, the newlyweds then jump over a ditchfire, signaling the end of the ceremony. Now to the feast!.

So many captains united in a single place normally pertains to days of arguing and planning, "The calm before the storm", you thought, as you chuckle. Suddenly the [From.job_spiritual.GetJobTitle], [From.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] you think the creature's name is, preaching gets louder. You glance over at the betrothed's family. Good match, good ships [From.Spouse.GetSheHe] will bring to the fleet. Finally, the drowned priest starts to bless the couple.

"Let [From.GetFirstName] and [From.Spouse.GetFirstName], your servants be born again from the sea, as you were. Bless them with salt, bless them with stone, bless them with steel." To which everyone gathered responds, "What is dead may never die." The priest then concludes, "What is dead may never die, but rises again, harder and stronger".

With the ceremony done, thralls guide the guests down the castle's halls where a feast is now waiting, and, with the Drowned God's blessing, a son for the newlyweds!

So many captains united in a single place normally pertains to days of arguing and planning, "The calm before the storm", you thought, as you chuckle. Suddenly the [From.job_spiritual.GetJobTitle], [From.job_spiritual.GetFirstName] you think the creature's name is, preaching gets louder. You glance over at the betrothed family. Good match, good ships they will bring to the fleet. Finally, the drowned priest starts to bless the couple.

"Let this wedded couple, your servants, be born again from the sea, as you were. Bless them with salt, bless them with stone, bless them with steel." To which everyone gathered responds, "What is dead may never die." The priest then concludes, "What is dead may never die, but rises again, harder and stronger".

With the ceremony done, thralls guide the guests down the castle's halls where a feast is now waiting, and, with the Drowned God's blessing, a son for the newlyweds!

The day of the wedding is finally here, the guests are all gathered here at [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] to watch the betrothed be finally united in matrimony. As you head over to where the ceremony is to be held, you can see the household staff guiding the first of the guests over to their seats. As you take your place near the shrine dedicated to [From.GetHighGodName], you wait while the ceremonial grounds fill with people.

Once everyone and everything appears to be in order, the bride finally enters, flanked by [From.Spouse.GetHerHis] family. She is delivered before [From.GetTitledFirstName], so as to be wed in sight of all the guests, Gods, and subjects of the realm.

Once the ceremony is over, you and the rest of the guests make way to where the wedding celebrations are to be held. While the first half of the day was a solemn one, the feast promises a welcome distraction!

The day of the wedding is finally here, the guests are all gathered here at [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] to watch the betrothed be finally united in matrimony. As you head over to where the ceremony is to be held, you can see the household staff guiding the first of the guests over to their seats. As you take your place near the shrine dedicated to [From.GetHighGodName], you wait while the ceremonial grounds fill with people.

Once everyone and everything appears to be in order, the bride finally enters, flanked by her family. She is delivered before [From.Heir.GetFirstName] [From.Heir.GetOnlyDynastyName], so as to be wed in sight of all the guests, Gods, and subjects of the realm.

Once the ceremony is over, you and the rest of the guests make way to where the wedding celebrations are to be held. While the first half of the day was a solemn one, the feast promises a welcome distraction!
What a joyous day!
Long live [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]!
I bet the ceremony was nice

With the ceremony finished, the celebration of a feast held in honor of the wedded couple is now being held. The hall is packed with people: the lords and ladies of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullBaseName], their wives and husbands, visiting [From.Culture.GetName] rulers and emissaries, all honored guests, truly a night to remember!\n\nAs the wine flows, so does the night, and so, perhaps no later than the hour of the eel, the nobles present begin swarming the married couple's table, with cheers and song, they begin carrying the newlyweds to the couple's room!

With the ceremony finished, the celebration of a feast held in honor of the wedded couple is now being held. The hall is packed with people: the lords and ladies of the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullBaseName], their wives and husbands, visiting [From.Culture.GetName] rulers and emissaries, all honored guests, truly a night to remember!\n\nAs the wine flows, so does the night, and so, perhaps no later than the hour of the eel, the nobles present begin swarming the married couple's table, with cheers and song, they begin carrying the host's heir and his wife to the couple's room!
Truly a remarkable day!
This was quite the celebration!

The wedding celebrations go well into the month, and you find yourself frequently spending time with your host, drinking wine and laughing over stories. You leave feeling as if the two of you have gained an excellent understanding of one another.
I've found a new friend!

As the wedding celebrations continues, you find yourself frequently in the company of [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], drinking wine and laughing over stories. While you would not have thought so initially, it seems as if the two of you have gained an excellent understanding of one another.

It was bound to happen. You drank a little too much at your host's keep, and when you ran into him you argued over the [argue_title.GetFullName] - which they hold, and which you believe rightfully belongs to you. Heated words were exchanged, to the point where guards had to politely separate the two of you.
This is not my fault!

It was bound to happen. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] drank too much at your great hall, and at one point in the night confronted you. [From.GetHerHisCap] words slurred from drink, [From.GetSheHe] argued with you over the [argue_title.GetFullName] - which you hold, but which [From.GetSheHe] believes rightfully belongs to [From.GetHerHim]. It caused quite the scene, reaching the point where guards had to politely separate the two of you.
How dare [From.GetSheHe]!

You suspected that [challenge_target.GetSheHe] might be at the wedding celebration, and sure enough...there [challenge_target.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is, laughing and carrying on. You despise the man, and with a few drinks in you, it occurs to you to challenge him to a duel right here and now.

You challenged [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], but [From.GetSheHe] spluttered excuses regarding how this was a happy occasion and you are both guests and so forth...and declined the challenge, much to his embarrassment.
The coward!

A series of shouts arose from your courtyard, as your guests parted the culprits were revealed: [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] with blade drawn, challenging [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] to a duel. Both men are ready to fight, and are asking for your leave to settle matters here and now.
Absolutely not! This is my castle, not a tavern!
Talk them out of the foolish idea
Why not? Some entertainment!

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] was furious at both of us for daring to ask to duel, all but ordering us out of the castle walls. We left, more bitter at [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] than at each other.
[From.GetSheHeCap] had no right to speak to me in that fashion!

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] listened to our request to fight, and instead of agreeing took us each aside in turn and spoke to us calmly. [From.GetSheHeCap] said that it would be unfortunate if either of us were hurt, as it would be a breach of hospitality, and begged us to reconsider...and [From.GetSheHe] was right. It was a foolish idea.
Another time, then

Those guests at the keep gathered as a duel ensued between [FromFromFrom.GetTitledName] and [FromFrom.GetTitledName], overseen by [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] [From.GetHerHim]self. The fight was a spectacle...and, in the end, [FromFromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] was stabbed by [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] and died!
Most unfortunate
The bastard killed me!
Ha! [From.GetSheHe] had it coming!
How scandalous!

Those guests at the keep gathered as a duel ensued between [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and [From.GetTitledName], overseen by [wedding_duel_host.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] [wedding_duel_host.GetHerHim]self. The fight was a spectacle...and, in the end, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] lost the duel and was badly wounded. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is victorious!
There, it is done
[From.GetSheHe] must have cheated!
Victory is mine!

Those guests at the keep gathered as a duel ensued between [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and [From.GetTitledName], overseen by [wedding_duel_host.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] [wedding_duel_host.GetHerHim]self. The fight was a spectacle...and, in the end, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] conceded defeat after first blood. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is victorious!

Those guests at the keep gathered as a duel ensued between [FromFrom.GetTitledName] and [From.GetTitledName], overseen by [wedding_duel_host.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] [wedding_duel_host.GetHerHim]self. The fight was a spectacle...and, in the end, [FromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] was stabbed by [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] and died!

The wedding celebrations were going so well...and then you saw [Spouse.GetFirstName]'s lover, there across the room, laughing and as brazen as [Root.GetSheHe] pleased. How could [Spouse.GetSheHe] invite [Root.GetHerHim]?
[Spouse.GetSheHeCap] does this to spite me!

The wedding celebrations were going so well...and then you saw [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] staring daggers at you. [From.GetSheHeCap] accosted you in front of your guests, making a scene over the fact your lover was present at the wedding! Eventually [From.GetSheHe] stormed off, but it was an embarrassing moment.
That could have gone...better
The wedding's festivities are going well...so well, in fact, that the muse has overtaken you. Perhaps an ode to your host, publicly declared for all to hear?
Yes! Wonderful!
No, I couldn't bear the shame

At one point in the wedding's festivities, [From.GetTitledName] stands and gets everyone's attention. [From.GetSheHe] delivers a poem in [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s honor...and it is beautiful. Those gathered are moved, and the applause afterward signifies that this ode will be written down and remembered.
Well done, [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]!
I couldn't be more pleased
How fabulous!

At one point in the wedding's festivities, [From.GetTitledName] stands and gets everyone's attention. [From.GetSheHe] delivers a poem in [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s honor...and it is terrible. Did [From.GetSheHe] intend to insult [From.GetHerHis] host, or was it an accident? The awkward coughs afterwards signify this moment is best forgotten.
Awkward, indeed...
No, this is terrible!
How awful!

'To our good host, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], long may [Root.GetSheHe] reign!'\n\n[From.GetTitledName] stands and delivers an eloquent toast in [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s honor at one of the wedding celebrations, prompting a round of approving applause from those gathered.
Many thanks, [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]!
Long may [Root.GetSheHe] reign!

In one of the banquets you sponsor in honor of the wedding, it seems everyone wants to dance with you. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] in particular, however, seems more interested than most. The way [From.GetSheHe] smiles at you, you suspect [From.GetSheHe] might be interested in more than just a dance with the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]...
Oh, really? Let's see where this goes...
A dance is more than sufficient

In one of the banquets you sponsor in honor of the wedding, it seems every [Root.GetManWomanOpp] wishes to dance with you. How tiresome. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] winks in your direction, seeming to understand your discomfort. Indeed, you suspect [From.GetSheHe] might understand better than most...
Let's talk in private, [From.GetFirstName]...
I'm not interested in [From.GetHerHim]

Across the grand hall you can hear it, [From.GetTitledName] has done nothing more than make caustic remarks about you when [From.GetSheHe] thinks you're not listening. You're not even certain why [From.GetSheHe] came to the wedding at all, if this is how [From.GetSheHe] feels.
Endure it-it's only one evening, after all
Confront [From.GetHerHim]-this needs to stop!

As if [From.GetHerHis] drinking weren't bad enough, [From.GetTitledName] managed to make quite the spectacle of [From.GetHerHim]self at the one of the banquets, dancing on tables and carrying on until finally [From.GetSheHe] vomited on the floor in front of everyone.
Oh, wonderful

For most of the ball, [From.GetTitledName] acted normally...or as normally as one can expect [From.GetHerHim] to be, perhaps. Then a servant placed the wrong flagon before [From.GetHerHim], and that set him off: ranting and raving, until finally the hall watched in silence as [From.GetSheHe] was escorted away.
You could hear [From.GetHerHim] screaming from the halls...

Now truly the last of the wedding celebrations are drawing to a close, with [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] giving alms to the smallfolk still gathered around the castle walls. Even they are dispersing, 'Long live the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]! Long live the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]!' can be heard, as everyday life returns to [From.Capital.GetName].
Let's hope so!
A fine event, indeed

The last of your wedding guests began making their travel preparations, clearly impressed by the opulence of the festivities. They are quick to change the date of their departure, snowfall being one of the most common excuses your bannermen use while enjoying your bountiful hospitality. It doesn't bother you, after all, your Northman will never forget the power you displayed here...

All over your halls you still see your guests, the festivities filling your keep with life. It's been days since the wedding, but lords from all over the Blackwater are still lodged in your castle. Truly, this event is sure to help you in the years to come in these war-torn lands.

Your castellan assures you there's nothing to worry about. Dornish red, exotic spices, meat, and salt are all well stocked and ready to be served. The festivities you're holding in the water gardens, which have been an ongoing affair for close to a month, could keep going for another one, he assures you. Satisfied you take another sip of wine...

It's been a long time since you last saw so many captains united in celebration, that didn't involve a successful raid at least. Once the drowned priest concluded the ceremony, your servants rushed in with many exotic merriments, which you boastfully state were all acquired by paying the iron price. It's been weeks since then, and you can still see many ships anchored in your harbor...

The vast quantities of wine and meat still being served at your halls astound your guests. The Stormlands are not known for their ample fields and wealthy nobility, but somehow what you display here comes close. You have every right to be as proud as you can be, as the grand celebrations you're hosting shall continue with no diminishing grandeur.

Even for the Reach, the sheer abundance you're displaying has the nobles gathered at your festivities talking. "Good!" you think, for in the Reach, wealth displayed is sometimes more effective than whatever force you could ever muster. And you sure mustered everything you could for this occasion.

Downstream you can see miles of tents. The smallfolk have gathered outside your castle for this merry occasion on the word of how grandiose it was. Inside your walls, however, the festivities now well into their second week have yet to die out. Surely, the pomp of the first day, and its more prestigious guests are gone, but minor lords and family still enjoy your vast hospitality.

You've planned this wedding meticulously, the more festive part of it dying out after the first week. You retained a grand part of your nobles with promises of tourneys to be held with significant winnings to its champion. Your guests have responded well, many still honoring your grand event with their presence.

There's scarcely a way to display power through wealth when most of the distinguished Houses in the west sit upon lush mines. But you surely did your best. Your galleries are full of eastern tapestries, the tables were and are still filled with all kinds of exotic foods and the wine, be it from Dorne or the Arbor, is nowhere near ending.
It was all worth it!

The last of your wedding guests began making their travel preparations. Those who still linger are hurriedly trying to settle small administrative matters, winter being one of the chief concerns amongst your bannermen. It doesn't bother you, after all, here in the North every drop of grain matters once white takes over the landscape...

Some of your sworn swords still haven't left. Most alarming is the fact that some of them are in charge of key fortifications along your borders. You try as best you can to accomodate your lords' needs for funds and arms. After all, here in the Blackwater, war is an every day occurrence, be it from the stormlords, reavers, or across the Narrow Sea.

Reports of highwaymen prowling the caravan routes in this high Dornish heat have retained some of your wedding guests inside your walls. Your servants assure you nothing will be wanted during their stay. It seems your water gardens will resume hosting some afternoon merriments for the next couple of days...

One thing is for sure, a man has a finite amount of fingers. It's been some days since the more rowdy bunch have left your walls. There's been no more finger dancing, as the captains that are still anchored have remained for more serious matters, new raids, different ports and wildly fictitious reports of loot all high on their priorities...

The men you sent to secure more wine and meat have returned after completing their task. The uncertainty of sending ships to sea here in the Stormlands on such an important matter made you take a risky gamble, but it paid off. You have nothing to worry about anymore and the guests still lodged in your keep shall continue to do so with no diminishing comfort.

After the wedding ceremony you're still hosting some minor Houses and landed nobility sworn to your banners. Even if you didn't display enormous pomp during the wedding and feast proper, these small gestures of hospitality and patronage do go a long way here in the Reach in solidifying your House's standings amongst its peers.

Talk of military affairs preoccupies your halls after the wedding. The Riverlands, since the Age of Heroes, has been considered a proving ground, a crossroads between Kingdoms, always desired. So with a new alliance secured, some of your bannermen remain in your keep to discuss matters of political importance with you.

Talk of clansmen stalking mountain roads have stalled some of your guests in leaving. Your castellan soothes your worst fears related to your guests' needs. It seems your conservative spending during the wedding preparations have borne fruit sooner than you imagined. Nevertheless, you send for your captain of guards, these marauders have to be stopped.

Most of the distinguished guests have already taken leave of your halls, but, some still remain, mostly those sworn directly to your House since time immemorial, always dependent on your fortune. They fraternize amongst themselves, always aggrandizing, and most desperate of all, seeking a nobler match.
An event well concluded!

The last of your wedding guests began making their travel preparations. These fourth sons, bastards, and young men-at-arms who still linger try desperately to find any form of employment that can guarantee a roof over their heads. These small matters apart, work in restoring the castle to its former state before the modest ceremony is almost complete...

Of your original guests practically only your in-laws haven't left yet, concerned about key points in your alliance long since discussed and agreed upon. You try as best you can to accomodate their new needs and demand. After all, here in the Blackwater, alliances are almost a necessity if one is to survive. You wonder if maybe a more pompous ceremony would've helped.

Your modest festivities long gone, just a handful of closer acquaintances remain. You order your household to share whatever's left from the feast with the beggars outside your walls. You know it isn't much, but it sure beats whatever the desperate souls will find in the desert...

Some of your most loyal captains are still anchored, concern around reaving and the Kingdom's borders flaring up during council. You make conservative promises, and give them some more or less real assurances. Their fears abated, you finally begin seeing them off your shores.

The Stormlands were always known to be a land of harsh mountains, stony shores, and lush forests. So whatever hospitality you manage to supply your guests with is always well received, your bannermen taking their leave in an orderly fashion, the hardy stormlanders always in high spirits.

After the small wedding ceremony, you're still hosting some men-at-arms, always eager to secure employment amongst the Reach noble Houses. Even if you didn't displayed enormous wealth during the event, these men know there will always be opportunity for service amongst the Reach nobility.

Now married, you take to the field once more. With a new alliance secured and a small stream of new blood brought by news of the occasion, it gives a good spin to a most humble and calm event. Your treasury not depleted of funds, maybe it's time you started some works around some of the fords near your keep.

The last of your guests finally leaving, it takes little effort by your servants in putting everything back in order. In the mountains of the Vale, once snow begins to settle one has to be ready to make a move away from the mountains, lest you fancy freezing to death. That's the reason for such a rushed affair, you keep telling yourself...

A most discreet affair has taken place in your halls, the last of the decorations finally going down. You quickly give orders to your household to quickly discard everything thats useful near where the smallfolk are camped. The quicker they pick their prizes, the quicker they will be back in the mines.
We did what we could under the circumstances.
